titles.title: To amend the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to restore the rate of duty applicable to man-made fiber felt fabric for technical uses that was in effect under the Tariff Schedules of the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 5/19/1993--Introduced. Amends the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to decrease the duty rate on straining cloth of a kind used in oil presses or the like including that of human hair (nonlaminated, chemically treated or coated, needleloom felt of man-made fibers). Increases the duty rate on other types of such fabrics.
